page.title: 09K.E.G.S.,Chelmsford (2)
page.content:
To obtain admission into the school the boys have to take an{examination at the{age}of{11.}As only{90}boys can {enter}the school{each year}it is necessary to gain very high marks. The number of{pupils}is now about{685 drawn from a{very wide catchment area of Essex. There are{300}boys in the {6th form.
Since it first opened the school has seen many changes but it has always sought to maintain the{highest acad- {emic standards.}A recent survey in 1981 of{Oxford and Cambridge Uni- {versity Entrance Awards}showed that {King Edward VI School, Chelmsford}was the{highest}placed{State school}in the {country.
